Posts.Content: i'm a stage 2a er/pr positive left side and trip neg right side survivor stage 2b. i'm having alot of rib pain under the breast area where the trip neg was. i am post op 5 weeks, lat flap. But this came out of nowhere. What are symptoms of  the ca spreading?
Posts.Title: breast spread to bone

Posts.Content: On May 01, 2012 2:36 PM pipperpain wrote: THERE MAY BE NO SYMPTOMS, BUT FORTUNATELY YOUR DOCTOR IS ON YOUR CASE AND WILL BE ALERT.  I WAS DIAGNOSED AT STAGE 4 AND THERE WERE NO SYMPTOMS EXCEPT A FUNNY LOOKING BOOB. THAT LED ME TO MY GENERAL PRACTIONER.  the pain in my back and feet were chalked up to standing on my feet all day at work,  The bone doctor blew me off even though my scans showed hot spots and uptake deposits.  My point is that you have a doctor that can stay on top of things with you.  I am stage 4 but doing very well.  Yesterday i climbed a ladder and renailed some flashing that was loose on my mothers home.  I live alone and 100% take care of myself.  I was rxd over a year ago. thannks for the advice. im also alone a d work and take ncare of myself. you are an inspiration.
Posts.Title: breast spread to bone
